summary: This bill, the Uterine Fibroid Intervention and Gynecological Health Treatment Act of 2025, aims to increase early detection and intervention for uterine fibroids. It authorizes the Secretary of Health and Human Services to award grants to states for research and programs, including screening, patient navigation, and the implementation of evidence-based strategies. The Secretary is also mandated to conduct research, formulate strategies, and submit reports to Congress detailing findings and developments related to the topic, including disparities in pain management.
